name: dimness
content:
dimness noun [U]
(NOT CLEAR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of not having or giving much light: The light bulb formed a bright spot in the dimness of the barn. The dimness of the weak candle hid the little blemishes on her face. He was barely visible in the dimness.
a lack of ability to see things well: The patient may complain of dimness of vision or impairment of hearing.

dimness noun [U]
(NOT CLEVER)
informal the fact of not being very clever: They show their dimness with every word they say. It was an indication of her friend's dimness that he had not thought to lock the door behind him.
